business.headline: Budget 2026: Will old tax regime survive and should new regime get deductions?Over the past few years, the government has steadily pushed the new tax regime as the default option while keeping the old regime alive for those with existing commitments and deductions.

Drowning in debt: How easy loans are turning into an EMI nightmare for IndiansMonth after month, salaries go to EMIs, essentials shrink, and families realise that what once felt temporary has become the new normal. Read on to understand how this silent debt crisis is unfolding within Indian households.

SIP investments hit record high in December 2025: AMFIThe latest data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) for December 2025 shows steady participation from retail investors, record SIP contributions and sustained interest in equity and hybrid schemes.
Is it possible for the US to put a price tag on Greenland?In 1946, the US offered to buy the vast, mineral-rich Arctic island from Denmark for $100 million, an offer that was rejected back then.

Will your PF keep earning interest after you have left job?Changing jobs is common today, but doubts around Provident Fund savings still linger. Many employees worry that their PF stops growing once they leave a job. The truth, however, is very different and often misunderstood.

Tax relief on the cards? What to expect from Budget 2026Changes to tax slabs, a higher exemption limit and a continued push towards the new tax regime helped reduce the tax burden for many families and eased pressure on households in budget 2025.
Sensex closes 605 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; NTPC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 604.72 points to close at 83,576.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 193.55 points to end at 25,683.30.

Gold, silver rates today: What should investors know amid global turmoilGold prices in India moved higher across all major purity levels on January 9. The price of 24K gold stood at Rs 13,871 per gram, up by Rs 71 from the previous session.

Govt ducks IMF's 'C' grade criticism in stunning RTI stonewall: No answers, no fixesOn the estimation of GDP and Gross Value Added (GVA) for the unorganised sector, MoSPI said it follows methodologies outlined in official documents released in 2012 and 2015, both available in the public domain.

Budget 2026: Hoping for a tax makeover? Why you might be disappointed this yearHoping Budget 2026 will finally bring sweeping tax changes? Experts suggest this may not be the year for big announcements or dramatic relief.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO fully booked on Day 1. Should you subscribe?BCCL IPO: The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026. Shares are proposed to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

Is sector rotation the real driver of returns in Indian equity markets?Sector rotation in its simplest form is the reaction of the market to shifts in the economic environment. The various sectors are enjoyed at various stages of the cycle.

Sensex falls over 600 points: What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Around 12:46 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 634.91 points to 83,546.05, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 188.80 points to 25,688.05. Most of the broader market indices also tumbled, reflecting the volatility on Dalal Street.

Still not received your income tax refund in 2026? Here's why it's taking timeWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can be stressful. If your FY 2024–25 income tax refund has not arrived yet in 2026, there are several common reasons behind the delay.

Trump's 500% tariff threat rattles Dalal Street. What should investors do now?Around 11:55 am, the Sensex was down nearly 450 points, while the NSE Nifty 50 had tumbled over 130 points, pushing the benchmark indices deeper into the red after a bruising week.

Budget 2026: Why insurance sector needs more than an FDI boostWith FDI reforms in place, Budget 2026 must prioritise affordability, trust and protection-led incentives to close India's insurance gap and turn reform momentum into real coverage for citizens.

Mutual fund inflows cool off in December, down 6% to Rs 28,054 croreData released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India, or AMFI, showed that inflows into equity mutual funds fell 6% in December to Rs 28,054 crore.

BHEL share price jumps over 4%. Why is the stock rising today?BHEL shares were trading at Rs 282.40, up Rs 10.10 or 3.71% as of 10:10 AM. The stock had closed at Rs 272.30 in the last session. It opened higher at Rs 279.10 and moved up further during the day..
Sensex gains over 200 points, Nifty above 25,900; BEL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 35.21 points to 84,145.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to 25,857.50 as of 9:28 am.

Sensex, Nifty trade setup: Will stock market fall again today?Both Sensex and Nifty have seen steady losses over the past four sessions. Nifty has fallen 1.7% during this period, while Sensex is down 1.8%.

entertainment.headline: His & Hers review: When a marriage, a murder, and a town full of secrets collideRelease Date:Thu Jan 08, 2026 The six-episode adaptation of Alice Feeney's bestseller features suspenseful twists and a strong cast but lacks originality, with predictable plot mechanics and a forgettable finale. It premiered on Netflix on January 8.

Rapper Flipperachi announces India tour after Dhurandhar success. Check dates After his viral song 'FA9LA' from 'Dhurandhar', Bahrain rapper Flipperachi announced his India tour dates. He is set to perform in Bengaluru on March 14.

Priyanka Chopra leaves for Golden Globes after New Year celebration with family After celebrating the New Year with her family, Priyanka Chopra has resumed work and is preparing to serve as a presenter at the Golden Globes on January 11, joining a roster of international stars.

Parasakthi box office Day 1: Sivakarthikeyan film starts strong after censor row Sudha Kongara's historical drama 'Parasakthi', starring Sivakarthikeyan in his 25th film, premiered in cinemas on Saturday, January 10, following a period of uncertainty over its censor clearance.

Nupur Sanon-Stebin Ben pop champagne, exchange vows in white wedding. Watch Nupur Sanon and Stebin Ben got married in a Christian ceremony on Saturday. The ceremony was attended by their close friends and family.

Prabhas slashed his fees by 33% for The Raja Saab: Report As per reports, Prabhas has slashed his fee by 33 per cent for The Raja Saab. The film, which released on January 9, is now inching close to the Rs 100-crore mark.

The Raja Saab: Fire breaks out in theatre after fans burst crackers inside A fire broke out during the screening of 'The Raja Saab' in an Odisha theatre after fans brought in aarti plates, lit lamps, and burst crackers, causing panic among attendees.

Khans at 60: Shah Rukh, Salman, Aamir and the tricky box office fight of 2026 In 2026, Ranveer Singh is back with Dhurandhar 2, Ranbir Kapoor stakes claim with Ramayana 1 while most South superstars have pan-India releases. Where do Shah Rukh, Salman and Aamir Khan stand?

The Raja Saab box office Day 2: Prabhas' film nears Rs 100 crore despite sharp dip After a strong opening, Prabhas' starrer 'The Raja Saab' experienced a significant decline in box office collections on its second day. Telugu markets lead the film's performance, while other language versions saw weaker numbers.

Say it's not true: Katie Leung told to deny racist backlash over Harry Potter role Actor Katie Leung recalled facing racist backlash over Harry Potter casting as Cho Chang. She said that online remarks from toxic fans made her "less outgoing."

Vivek Oberoi cheers as Kantara Chapter 1 enters Oscar race: Roar of ancestors Vivek Oberoi cheered for 'Kantara Chapter 1' as the film has been listed by The Academy among the 201 film titles eligible for the Best Picture category. Vivek praised Rishab Shetty and expressed his admiration for the Bhuta Kola tradition.

Hrithik Roshan's 52nd birthday: Saba Azad wishes days of fulfilling creation Saba Azad shared an emotional message for her partner Hrithik Roshan on his 52nd birthday. She shared a series of pictures from their holidays and lunch outings.

Parasakthi is victory garland for DMK history: Kamal Haasan to Udhayanidhi Stalin Kamal Haasan wrote a letter to Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin, praising Sivakarthikeyan's 'Parasakthi' as a 'war-drum' for the upcoming elections. He blessed the film, calling it as a "victory garland" for DMK history.

Border 2: Colonel Hoshiar Singh Dahiya's wife blesses Varun Dhawan, praises actor PVC (Parm Vir Chakra) Colonel Hoshiar Singh Dahiya's wife showered praise on Varun Dhawan for sincerely portraying her husband's legacy in Border 2. The film is set for a theatrical release on January 23, 2026.

Rani Mukerji's Mardaani 3 release moved ahead: Cop drama to arrive on January 30 Rani Mukerji is back as the fearless cop Shivani Shivaji Roy in Mardaani 3. The film's new poster reveals its release date has been moved ahead to January 30, 2026.

Vijay's Theri to re-release for Pongal after Jana Nayagan's censor row Celebrating its tenth anniversary, the action thriller 'Theri' hits theatres worldwide on January 15, 2026. Vijay portrays a dual role in the 2016 action film.

Masterchef India 9 contestant inspires Ranveer, Vikas with Parkinson's battle 'Masterchef India Season 9' contestant Mini impressed Chefs Vikas Khanna and Ranveer Brar with her resilience, viewing cooking as a vital form of therapy and a way to inspire others through her "magic." Judges gave her a standing ovation for her dedication and passion for cooking.

Hrithik turns 52: Rakesh Roshan sends love, sister Sunaina posts childhood pics On Hrithik Roshan's 52nd birthday, his sister Sunaina Roshan and father Rakesh Roshan shared emotional messages and rare family photographs, offering fans a glimpse into the actor's early life.

Closest thing to God in my life: Allu Arjun's birthday wish for father Allu Aravind Actor Allu Arjun extended his heartfelt wishes to producer and father Allu Aravind on his 77th birthday. The 'Pushpa' actor wrote a personal message and photo in front of the newly launched Allu Cinemas.

general news.headline: US to strike Iran? Trump says ready to help amid brutal crackdown on protesters Live UpdatesWith at least 72 killed and 2,300 detained, Iran's protests have gone global, even as US President Donald Trump weighed military options and Tehran threatens demonstrators with death penalty charges.

Mahayuti releases manifesto for Mumbai civic polls, promises slum-free citySeveral key leaders, including Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, Ramdas Athawale, Vinod Tawde, Ameet Satam, and Ashish Shelar were present during the launch of the electoral manifesto.

Festival of India's existence: PM leads event to honour Somnath Temple defendersPrime Minister Narendra Modi led the Shaurya Yatra at Somnath Temple, highlighting India's enduring civilisational strength and resilience through centuries of challenges. The event celebrated a thousand years of faith, courage and cultural pride linked to the ancient shrine.

Earlier, Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl first at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. This is the first ever men's ODI match at this stadium.

How kabaddi lost its soul with blood, bullets, big money and calls from CanadaKabaddi has undergone a jarring metamorphosis in the last 15 years. Once the enchanting heartbeat of rural Punjab, criminal syndicates infiltrated tournaments, brought big money, feuds and bullet deaths. At times, the violence has a Canada angle.

Troops bled from nose, vomited blood: Did US use a sonic weapon in Venezuela?US forces reportedly used an advanced and previously unseen sonic weapon during a raid in Venezuela, incapacitating local troops with intense sound waves. This operation has sparked widespread attention and raised concerns about new military technologies in the region.

India scared of me: Pahalgam kingpin brags about invites from Pak armySaifullah Kasuri, the deputy chief of Hafiz Saeed-led outfit and the mastermind of the Pahalgam terror attack, made the remarks while addressing school children in a function organised at a school in Pakistan. He also claimed that India is scared because of his presence and issued provocative threats against New Delhi.

Delhi RWA president shot dead, was key witness in husband's murder caseA 44-year-old woman, Rachna Yadav, was shot dead at point-blank range in Shalimar Bagh, with CCTV footage capturing the accused fleeing on a motorcycle.

Red carpets to red flags: Why celebrity biohacking is a health blind spotWhen celebrities biohack in public, experimentation becomes an endorsement. Devices meant for controlled settings are quickly reframed as wellness upgrades, nudging millions to optimise their bodies and brains without fully understanding the risks involved.

Digitally arrested for 17 days, NRI couple in Delhi duped of nearly Rs 15 croreThe fraud came to light on January 10 when the couple was sent to a police station on the pretext of an RBI refund, where officers confirmed they had been cheated of Rs 14.85 crore.

Tubelight in his head: Owaisi, Himanta Sarma trade barbs over hijab-clad PM remarkAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma engaged in a sharp war of words after Owaisi spoke of his dream of a hijab-clad woman becoming India's Prime Minister, citing constitutional inclusivity.

Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil arrested in 3rd rape case hours after custodyExpelled Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil from Kerala's Palakkad has been arrested in connection with a third rape complaint, intensifying the political turmoil surrounding him. The arrest follows multiple allegations and his expulsion from the party, marking a significant development in the ongoing legal case.

Cybercafe in space: Rent this Indian AI satellite for price of a cup of coffeeTwo Hyderabad startups are democratising the stars by launching a pay-as-you-go orbital laboratory. This mission features the world's lightest monolithic telescope and an AI brain rentable for $2 a minute.

X admits mistake, deletes 600 accounts, bars obscene images: Govt sourcesX blocked around 3,500 posts, deleted over 600 accounts, and pledged to stop obscene imagery following action by Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

The dogs are watching usIn three consecutive days of hearing as to whether streets must be cleared of stray dogs and if they must be sent away to shelters, Supreme Court observed much and lawyers argued a lot. The result: a slew of quotable quotes for both dog-loving and dog-baiting humans.

Uninvestable: Trump's $100-billion Venezuela pitch is a no-deal for oil giantsTrump urged oil giants to invest in Venezuela, promising full US protection and control, as Washington moves to sell sanctioned crude and unlock $100 billion in private energy investment.

Budget 2026: Will old tax regime survive and should new regime get deductions?Over the past few years, the government has steadily pushed the new tax regime as the default option while keeping the old regime alive for those with existing commitments and deductions.

The Ashes was a spectacle. Why doesn't Test cricket in India feel the same?The Ashes reminded us that when the fan comes first, Test cricket still commands time, attention and awe even in a distracted world. In India, the format does not need saving in India, but it does need reimagining.

Delhi shivers as mercury dips below 4 degrees in several areas, Aya Nagar at 2.9°CDelhi is experiencing a severe cold wave with temperatures plunging below 4 degrees Celsius in several areas, causing discomfort across the city.

sports.headline: IND vs NZ: Arshdeep Singh snub for 1st ODI sparks fan fury over 'blatant favouritism' IND vs NZ: Arshdeep Singh was left out of India's playing XI for the first ODI against New Zealand in Vadodara. The decision sparked fan outrage, with many questioning selection logic despite his strong recent ODI and domestic form.

While Indian football burns, AIFF chief kickstarts FIFA World Cup trophy tour in Delhi With Indian football in crisis, AIFF chief Kalyan Chaubey and Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya launched the FIFA World Cup trophy tour in Delhi. The timing sparked fan backlash over optics amid the sport's ongoing domestic turmoil.

Dhruv Jurel replaces injured Rishabh Pant, joins ODI team in Vadodara India vs New Zealand: Dhruv Jurel has been added to India's ODI squad following Rishabh Pant's injury setback. The Uttar Pradesh wicketkeeper has joined the squad in Vadodara, the BCCI confirmed.

Watch: Rishabh Pant suffers painful series-ending blow during IND vs NZ training IND vs NZ: A viral video has captured the moment Rishabh Pant suffered the abdominal blow during India's Vadodara training session. The injury, confirmed a day earlier, ruled him out of the ODI series against New Zealand.

Unstoppable: A criminal lawyer defying odds to chase Paralympics dream A criminal lawyer by trade and a long-distance runner by heart, Penav Mota looks to break down the barriers and represent India in the Paralympics soon.

Earlier, Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl first at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. This is the first ever men's ODI match at this stadium.

Varun Chakravarthy will be key for India in T20 World Cup: Sourav Ganguly Sourav Ganguly has underlined Varun Chakravarthy's importance to India's T20 World Cup title defence at home. The former captain believes India's strong spin attack could be the defining factor in familiar conditions.

Beyond the Ro-Ko madness: Stars hope to maximise ODI series to cut out noise IND vs NZ: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are enjoying a purple patch in ODI cricket, as they get ready for the series against New Zealand. The star duo will need to ensure that they deliver a world-class performance to ensure that the noise around them will be kept on mute during their rest period.

FA Cup: Manchester City score 10 past Exeter City, Antoine Semenyo bags a debut goal Manchester City launched their FA Cup campaign with a brutal 10-1 rout of Exeter City at the Etihad Stadium. Debutant Antoine Semenyo starred with a goal and assist in a record-equalling third-round win.

Watch: Virat Kohli's special pep-talk, autographs ball for Vadodara nets boweler Virat Kohli's pep-talk and signed ball for a Vadodara net bowler went viral after India's training session. The moment reflected the confidence and calm in the camp ahead of the first ODI against New Zealand.

Ro-Ko aim to end season on high as ODI cricket readies for 4-month hibernationIND vs NZ 1st ODI: India are set to play a 3-match ODI series against New Zealand. This will be the team's last ODI assignment till June 2026. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will be in focus.

Real Madrid vs Barcelona, Super Cup final livestreaming: When and where to watchBarcelona and Real Madrid will face each other in the 2026 Supercopa de España final, marking their fourth consecutive final encounter. Barcelona aims for a record-extending 16th title, while Real Madrid seeks to avenge last season's defeat.

New Zealand to lean on Jamieson to lead attack, Kristian Clarke set for debutStand-in captain Michael Bracewell said that New Zealand will lean on the experience of Kyle Jamieson to lead their pace attack during the ODI series against India. Bracewell also confirmed that Kristian Clarke will make his debut during the first ODI.

Jemimah refuses to let nightmare captaincy debut define WPL seasonWPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues remained upbeat despite Delhi Capitals' heavy 50-run defeat to Mumbai Indians on Saturday in Navi Mumbai, urging patience and backing a strong comeback.

Indian football board asks clubs to confirm home venues to begin scheduling of ISLAIFF has asked ISL clubs to confirm their home venues by January 12, a key step towards finalising schedules as the delayed league prepares to return on February 14.

IND vs NZ: Rishabh Pant ruled out of ODIs due to abdominal injuryIND vs NZ: India suffered a big blow ahead of the New Zealand ODIs as Rishabh Pant has been ruled out of the upcoming series due to a abdominal injury on the eve of the first ODI on Saturday, January 10.

SG Pipers claim Women's Hockey India League after shootout win vs Bengal TigersSG Pipers clinched the Women's Hero Hockey India League 2025–26 title after a 1–1 draw and a 3–2 shootout victory over Shrachi Bengal Tigers, with goalkeeper Bansari Solanki making decisive saves.

Jemimah's big night ends in nightmare as Mumbai Indians hand brutal reality-checkWPL 2026 match today, DC vs MI: Jemimah Rodrigues' captaincy debut ended in disappointment as Mumbai Indians delivered a ruthless all-round performance in Navi Mumbai, cruising to a thumping win and exposing DC's flaws early.

Tata Chess Blitz: Arjun Erigaisi in second, Nihal Sarin stuns Viswanathan AnandArjun Erigaisi is hot on the heels of Wesley So, who took the sole lead in the Open Blitz after nine rounds, while Carissa Yip edged ahead in the Women's Blitz. Nihal Sarin pulled off a big upset over Viswanathan Anand with a stunning performance.

Bangladesh yet to receive response from ICC on T20 World Cup: BCB presidentBCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul said Bangladesh are still awaiting a response from the ICC on security concerns over playing T20 World Cup matches on Indian soil.

FA Cup holders Crystal Palace crash out after 1-2 defeat to sixth-tier MacclesfieldSixth-tier Macclesfield knocked out title holders Crystal Palace in a dramatic 2-1 victory, defying the odds and sending shockwaves through the FA Cup. The gulf between the teams was evident, but Macclesfield's belief and composure overcame Premier League opposition in front of jubilant home fans.

Mary Kom breaks silence on her divorce: He was not the man I believed him to beMary Kom has spoken out on her divorce, financial distress and public slander, saying her silence was being misread. The boxing legend says she felt forced to speak during her darkest phase.

What just happened? Sneh Rana's bizarre no-ball steals spotlight against MISneh Rana stole the spotlight in WPL 2026 with a bizarre no-ball that left players and fans stunned during the match between Delhi Capitals and Mumbai Indians on Saturday in Navi Mumbai.

RCB sensation Lauren Bell achieves another major landmark after dream WPL debutEngland pacer Lauren Bell enjoyed a dream Women's Premier League debut for Royal Challengers Bengaluru against Mumbai Indians, capping a match-winning spell with the milestone of one million Instagram followers.

Lizelle Lee goes full Supergirl with stunner on WPL debut for Delhi Capitals: WatchWPL 2026, MI-W vs DC-W: Lizelle Lee's WPL debut for Delhi Capitals blended chaos and brilliance as the retired South African pulled off two stunning catches, stamped her authority in the field and turned the game on its head.

Pratika Rawal turns cheerleader for UP Warriorz despite being sidelined by injuryDespite being sidelined by ankle and knee injuries, Pratika Rawal showed her unwavering support for UP Warriorz by cheering from the stands during their WPL opener against Gujarat Giants in Navi Mumbai.

Who is Anushka Sharma? Virat Kohli fan steals spotlight on WPL debutAnushka Sharma marked her Women's Premier League debut for Gujarat Giants with a brisk 44 off 30 deliveries, forming a key partnership with Ashleigh Gardner against UP Warriorz. A Virat Kohli fan, Anushka, was able to grab the attention of everyone with her brilliant knock with the bat.

Birmingham turns pink as FA Cup stadium lights reflect off snowThe city of Birmingham had pink skies on a dreamy winter's night. Social media users put up photos and videos of the pink sky, calling it wondrous. What caused the phenomenon?

MI vs DC Highlights: Mumbai thrash Delhi by 50 runs, recovers from RCB defeatMumbai Indians vs Delhi Capitals, WPL 2026 Highlights: Mumbai Indians hammered Delhi Capitals by 50 runs to open their campaign in the tournament. Chinelle Henry scored 56, but Nicola Carey and Amelia Kerr took three-wicket hauls to take the two-time champions past the finish line.

Meg Lanning's UP Warriorz journey begins with defeat as Gujarat Giants win thrillerWPL 2026, GG vs UPW: Meg Lanning made a tough start to her journey with the UP Warriorz after Gujarat Giants edged them in the thriller on Saturday in Navi Mumbai. Georgia Wareham won the Player of the Match effort for her all-round effort.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
